definition: dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: However, in their sleep really "no-take" effect?
sentences.chinese: 然而人在睡梦中就真的“无接”了么？

sentences.english: The telephone roused me from my sleep in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 早晨电话声把我从睡梦中弄醒了。

sentences.english: I missed my sister's sleepy mumbles.
sentences.chinese: 我想念妹妹睡梦中的呢喃。

sentences.english: The old cat quietly packed up in his sleep .
sentences.chinese: 那只老猫在睡梦中静静地死去。

sentences.english: Hearing the song of prosperity in my dreamland.
sentences.chinese: 睡梦中听见盛世的欢唱。

sentences.english: It might be said that the zebra finches were practising their songs while they slumbered.
sentences.chinese: 可以这么说，斑胸草雀正在睡梦中练习唱歌。

sentences.english: The Mayor seemed to start out of sleep himself.
sentences.chinese: 市长自己也好象刚从睡梦中醒回来一般。

sentences.english: The next morning we wake to the thump of hooves.
sentences.chinese: 第二天清晨，砰砰的马蹄声把我们从睡梦中惊醒。

sentences.english: In the morning, Son woke up, laughing from his sleeping.
sentences.chinese: 早晨儿子又从睡梦中笑醒了。

sentences.english: The sick man moaned in his sleep.
sentences.chinese: 这生病的男人在睡梦中呻吟。

sentences.english: A stroke of fate hit those nine persons in their sleep.
sentences.chinese: 噩运临到了睡梦中的这九个人。

sentences.english: In the season when ice and snow start to thaw , I slowly wake up from a sound, rosy sleep.
sentences.chinese: 在冰雪开始融化的季节，我渐渐地从酣然睡梦中醒来。

sentences.english: The noise aroused me from sleep.
sentences.chinese: 喧闹声把我从睡梦中吵醒。

sentences.english: The inspiration struck Dwyer in his sleep.
sentences.chinese: 德怀尔在睡梦中得到了灵感。

sentences.english: When dreams of your presence my slumbers beguile.
sentences.chinese: 我在睡梦中被你的幻影蒙骗。

sentences.english: The wails of the siren woke the people out of their dreams.
sentences.chinese: 汽笛的啸鸣把人们从睡梦中惊醒。

definition: to rouse/to be woken by sth/to wake with a start/to sleep lightly
to awaken/to wake sb up/to rouse
to sleep soundly/to fall into a deep sleep
to wake sb up with a noise
midnight/in the middle of the night
to be fast asleep/(fig.) to lie dormant/to lie undiscovered
